title: One donation can save three lives
description: A single pint of donated blood can help up to three different patients in need.

title: Blood has a short shelf life
description: Red blood cells must be used within 42 days and platelets within 5 days.

title: Only 1 in 30 people donate
description: Despite the demand, only a small percentage of eligible donors actually donate blood.

title: Your body replaces it quickly
description: The plasma from your donation is replaced within about 24 hours, and red cells in a few weeks.

title: O-negative is the universal donor
description: O-negative blood can be given to any patient in an emergency, regardless of blood type.

title: You can donate every 3 months
description: Healthy adults can safely donate whole blood every 12 weeks.

title: Blood cannot be manufactured
description: Blood can only come from healthy human donors—there's no substitute.

title: One car accident victim may need 100 pints
description: Severe trauma victims may require large quantities of blood transfusions to survive.

title: Type AB is the universal plasma donor
description: People with AB blood type can donate plasma to anyone, which is vital in emergencies.

title: A healthy diet helps your blood
description: Iron-rich foods like spinach and lentils boost hemoglobin, making you a stronger donor.

title: You burn calories when donating
description: Donating a pint of blood can burn up to 650 calories!

title: Blood donations help cancer patients
description: Many cancer patients need blood transfusions during chemotherapy and recovery.

title: Young donors are needed
description: New, younger donors are essential to ensure future blood supply remains stable.

title: Blood makes up 7-8% of body weight
description: The average adult has about 10–12 pints of blood in their body.

title: You get a free health check
description: Before donating, your blood pressure, hemoglobin, and pulse are checked for free.

title: Donating is safe and painless
description: The process is performed with sterile, single-use equipment and takes only 10–15 minutes.

title: Platelets help cancer and trauma patients
description: Platelets are essential for blood clotting and are often needed by chemotherapy patients.

title: Summer and holidays have shortages
description: Blood donations drop during holidays and vacations, creating critical shortages.

title: Most people are eligible
description: Most healthy individuals aged 18–65 can safely donate blood.

title: Your donation travels fast
description: Blood donations are usually tested, processed, and sent to hospitals within 48–72 hours.

title: Your blood type matters
description: Matching blood types ensures safe transfusions and helps the right patients.

title: Frequent donors are heroes
description: Regular donors save countless lives over time through consistent contributions.

title: Blood donation is rewarding
description: Many donors feel a sense of pride, knowing they helped someone in need.

title: Donors are community lifelines
description: Local donations support nearby hospitals and neighbors in critical situations.

title: You can donate platelets and plasma too
description: Beyond whole blood, you can donate platelets and plasma through specialized processes.
